USER:  sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y nfs-kernel-server
  sudo bash -c 'echo "/mnt/Wolf-backup-4TB *(rw,sync,no_subtree_check,no_root_squash)" >> /etc/exports'
  sudo bash -c 'echo "/mnt/Wolf-backup-1TB *(rw,sync,no_subtree_check,no_root_squash)" >> /etc/exports'
  sudo exportfs -a
  sudo systemctl enable --now nfs-kernel-server
want you to give those to the cloud-gateway for nas storage

ASSISTANT: [THINKING]
The user wants me to set up NFS server on this node (181 - csmcloud-server) to share the Wolf backup drives with cloud-gateway. The commands will:
1. Install NFS kernel server
2. Export /mnt/Wolf-backup-4TB and /mnt/Wolf-backup-1TB with full access
3. Apply exports and enable NFS service
